div.blockquote: A smooth, even pleasurable introduction to the power of XQuery and XML content management

section.title: Overview
section.p: eXist is an Open Source native XML database featuring efficient, index-based XQuery processing, automatic structural indexing, extensions for full-text search, XUpdate support, XQuery update extensions (based on an early draft of XQuery Update Facility 1.0) and tight integration with existing XML development tools. The database implements most of the current XQuery 1.0 recommendation, with exception of the schema import and schema validation features defined as optional in the XQuery specification.

eXist provides a powerful environment for the development of web applications based on XQuery and related standards. Entire web applications can be written in XQuery, using XSLT, XHTML, CSS and maybe Javascript (for AJAX functionality). XQuery server pages can be executed from the filesystem or stored in the database.

To avoid memory-intensive document tree traversals during query processing, eXist uses an efficient structural index structure which is based on a numerical indexing scheme for identifying XML nodes in the index.

section.title: Download
section.p: eXist-db can be downloaded as a izPack installer (as jar and exe), a war webarchive for deployment into a servlet container and finally as a Cocoon block.

section.title: Community Support
section.p: The eXist-db has a large community of users and developers, which is very active. The primary medium for asking questions, getting help or posting bug reports or fixes is the project mailing list. To subscribe/unsubscribe visit the mailing lists page on sourceforge.
Previous messages posted on the are archived on nabble.com and gmane.org provides a NNTP interface.
The project has an chat box #existdb which is accessible via IRC on irc.freenode.net and via an AJAX based web interface. The channel is open for general discussions on eXist and related subjects.
All eXist-db sources are freely available via a SourceForge subversion repository. The source code is made browsable and is continuously monitored and built.
